item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 29, 2024 at 1:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Send someone you appreciate an official 'Continue and Persist' Letter (212 points | 28 comments)
2. Hetzner raises prices while significantly lowering bandwidth (US) (234 points | 170 comments)
3. The UX of Lego Interface Panels (2020) (220 points | 23 comments)
4. The success and failure of Ninja (2020) (99 points | 24 comments)
5. Engineers Do Not Get to Make Startup Mistakes When They Build Ledgers (15 points | 12 comments)
6. A pretty visualisation of the European power grid (2022) (195 points | 99 comments)
7. Tk9.0: CGo-free, cross platform GUI toolkit for Go (129 points | 38 comments)
8. In the Rockets' Red Glare: The past and future of hot-rodding in America (32 points | 13 comments)
9. AI and the Last Mile 2: Subsidiarity (24 points | 4 comments)
10. Rapid colonization of a space-returned Ryugu sample by terrestrial microorganism (44 points | 17 comments)
11. Bootkitty: Analyzing the first UEFI bootkit for Linux (100 points | 41 comments)
12. The Denver OWASP Chapter is proud to present SnowFROC '25 (6 points | discuss)
13. A new start after 60: I became a 'hummingbird' for people with dementia (72 points | 5 comments)
14. The Thinker Who Believed in Doing (2018) (8 points | discuss)
15. You can use C-Reduce for any language (456 points | 102 comments)
16. QwQ: Alibaba's O1-like reasoning LLM (284 points | 209 comments)
17. London's 850-year-old food markets to close (245 points | 202 comments)
18. Aftershock II (3 points | discuss)
19. Show HN: Myphotos.site – Make a gallery website from Google Photos (142 points | 70 comments)
20. Malware can turn off webcam LED and record video, demonstrated on ThinkPad X230 (966 points | 498 comments)
21. Goodbye, Rust. I wish you success but I'm back to C++ (sorry, it is a rant) (156 points | 132 comments)
22. In Praise of Print: Reading Is Essential in an Era of Epistemological Collapse (294 points | 268 comments)
23. Spotify has shut down several API endpoints (138 points | 102 comments)
24. A washing machine for human beings, from 1970 (121 points | 157 comments)
25. MIT Aluminum Bicycle Project 1974 (2016) (170 points | 133 comments)
26. Bananas: Cross-Platform screen sharing made simple (173 points | 44 comments)
27. Show HN: Voice-Pro – AI Voice Cloning (235 points | 155 comments)
28. PRoot: User-space implementation of chroot, mount –bind, and binfmt_misc (117 points | 47 comments)
29. Show HN: Feels Like Paper (239 points | 79 comments)
30. Developing a cancer drug without Big Pharma: this hospital shows it can be done (182 points | 131 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 29, 2024 at 1:15 AM UTC
